title: Occidental Family on MyFonts
content:
Hey everyone,

Just a quick note to let you all know that the Occidental family is now available through Myfonts.

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/ryancorey/occidental/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203011549/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ryancorey/occidental/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/ryancorey/occidental/")

The Occidental family is a geometric, sans-serif text face marked by its angular construction.

Occidental is suitable and economical enough to set large blocks of copy, but at display sizes Occidentalâ€™s inherent character takes over making it useful for headline setting as well.

The family includes four weights, each with corresponding italics (excepting Display) for a total of seven fonts.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203011549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/25625_5531.png)
author: RC

comments.content:
Congratulations on the release, Ryan. This is an interesting mix of curves and straights.

Not to pigeonhole the typeface, but I could see it finding an audience with hip design firms and cultural organizations.
